comments.body:
Since the states behave in the same manner, IMO, its redundant to describe it in every single RM. I have opened a docs request to add the description of the network resource module states in one place and then add a link to this doc in every RM.

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/65598

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +122,126 @@        C(show configuration commands | grep 'static route')
    type: str
  state:
    description:
      - The state of the configuration after module completion.

comments.body: Please add examples for the other states too.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +615,619 @@# vyos@vyos# run show configuration commands | grep static
# set protocols 'static'


# Using deleted to delete static route based on afi

comments.body: Could you modify the example to be more clear about how `replaced` would only affect the specified destination network under an AFI and keep the others untouched?
Maybe add another IPv4 destination network in the config and show that it is not getting changed?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +247,251 @@# -------------
#
# vyos@vyos:~$ show configuration commands| grep static
# set protocols static route 192.0.2.32/28 'blackhole'
# set protocols static route 192.0.2.32/28 next-hop '192.0.2.6'
